meanings.definition: Members of a group of American militiamen during the Revolutionary War who were known for their readiness to fight at a minute's notice.
meanings.sent1: The minutemen gathered quickly to defend their town from the enemy.
meanings.sent2: The minutemen were always prepared to protect their community.
meanings.sent3: The minutemen joked that they could finish a battle in a minute!
meanings.sent4: The spirit of the minutemen lives on in those who are always ready to stand up for what is right.
meanings.sent5: The image of the minutemen charging into battle is etched in history.

meanings.definition: A person who is punctual and precise in their actions or work.
meanings.sent1: As a minuteman, he arrived at the meeting exactly on time.
meanings.sent2: The boss appreciated the minuteman's dedication to being on schedule.
meanings.sent3: The minuteman's alarm clock was set to the minute!
meanings.sent4: She was a minuteman in her job, never missing a deadline.
meanings.sent5: His reputation as a minuteman for details made him a valuable team member.
